verses.verse: I am dying with a tortured spirit, and wishing for a burial, but do not obtain it.
I am supplicating in distress, yet what have I done? Strangers have stolen my substance; who is the man?
Let him be brought to trial with me.
Because thou hast hid their heart from understanding, thou shouldst not for this cause exalt them.
Shall he reckon misfortunes for his portion; and were his eyes melted for his children?
But thou hast made me a by-word among nations, and I am become a subject of laughter for them.
For mine eyes are dim with sorrow, and I am closely besieged by all.
At this the upright are astonished.
Now the righteous should prevail over the wicked: and he who is faithful should hold on his way: and he who hath clean hands should take courage.
On these maxims you all rely. But come now; for I do not find truth among you:
my days have passed in groans, and my very heart strings are broken.
I have put night for day. Is light near on account of darkness?
For though I have waited patiently, the mansion of the dead is to be my house, and my bed is made in darkness.
I have called on death to be my father; and on corruption to be my sister and mother.
Where then have I any ground of hope? Or shall I see those good things of mine?
Shall they go down with me to the mansion of the dead? Or shall we go together beneath the mound?
